Now, five years after I first crossed the Jeuno Straits and began my slow southward survey of Mindartia, I have arrived at the southernmost land: the plains of Sarutabaruta.1�
The Tarutaru who live here are a kind and friendly people; it is hard to believe their ancestors plotted the conquest of the world during the age of great magic.1�
They, too, worship the Goddess Altana, yet they believe that She has a form here on Vana'diel called the Star Sibyl, who lives in a giant tree.1�
I met the Star Sibyl, and she took my hand and spoke to me of everything from the current state of our world to the unseeable future. It was a wonderful experience.1�
The Tarutaru have agreed to give me a magical ship to speed the rest of my survey. I thank the Sibyl, and her kind people. --Enid Ironheart, 778 Crystal Era.1�

My dear Lady Shikaree G, what a pleasant surprise! I fear, however, that my castle is in a less-than-prrresentable state.1�
Tell me, Lehko.1�
Is it by mere coincidence that I find you here amidst all this misforrrtune?1�
As intimidating as ever, I see. You're trrruly worthy of the title of sin hunter.1�
Now, if you'll excuse me for answerrring your question with another question--what is this unhealthy obsession you have with me? Do you that badly desirrre my head?1�
...If Lehko Habhoka is trrruly who you are!1�
Lehko Habhoka is supposed to have met his end by my hand--unbeknownst to otherrrs.1�
At this very moment, he should be spending his eternal slumber in the murky depths of a frrrozen lake.1�
A frozen lake, you say? Gives me the chills just thinking about it. But, if what you say is trrrue, then what do you propose me to be? Some kind of apparition?1�
Enough of your games! You will come down here and answer to justice this instant!1�
Hmm...King's tear moths, if I'm not mistaken?1�
These moths can detect the scent of sin--a scent that never fades away. You can rrrun all you want, Lehko, but you cannot hide.1�
I commend you on your resourcefulness. Howeverrr...1�
What are you--!?1�
But if you'd be so kind as to oblige the whims of a condemned man, I'd like to be arrround just long enough to see how events unfold on this continent.1�
After that's over and done with, you won't hear a single squeal of complaint from me the next time you come for my head.1�
Hmph... You will answer for your sins sooner or laterrr. Don't ever forget it, Lehko Habhoka...1�
Phew... The scary woman's finally gone.1�
Feel frrree to come out now,  !1�
It's been a while. I trust you've been well?1�
Who was that ill-tempered lady, you ask?1�
You're not jealous, are you? She's just someone I know, and nowherrre near as fetching as you,  .1�
That's a tough question, actually. Not exactly an acquaintance...and not exactly a friend eitherrr. Let's call her the bane of my existence, and leave it at that, shall we?1�
So what can I do for you today? No wait, let me take a guess.1�
You've been asked by Romaa to find and bring me back. Am I right, or am I rrright?1�
Sorry, but I cannot comply.1�
Think about it from my perspective for a second. Going back to where all those murrrderous ladies are would be like marching to my death.1�
U-ugh!�
I'm...absolutely...starrrved...1�
Lehko's stomach rumbles fiercely!�

I feel so faint, I can't take another step...1�
Of all the Goddess-forrrsaken timing...why must this ill-fortune befall me the very moment I change my mind about not going back to Windurst with you?1�
